channel.title: Making client one file
channel.description: Well people are starting to dupe on my server with a different client, they are finding my UID. I want to make my client only 1 file so people can't find my UID from the signlink. Im sure I can somehow make my client into a jar or exe and I have a Jar Maker, I just don't know how to use it. I need some major help - please help!

item.title: Making client one file
item.dc:creator: @Markian Markian
item.description:
@Markian wrote:

[quote="`Rich, post:4, topic:292632"]Make your custom client send extra information to the server to filter it from other clients, then obfuscate and jar it.[/quote] When I Jar my file the GUI does not come up. I put my Manifest as client. Oh yeah, any examples that I could send, because I have no idea where to start.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 03, 2009, 02:38:07 pm[/size][hr]Anyone? Bump.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 03, 2009, 04:08:26 pm[/size][hr]Come on guys - please help.

Read full topic

item.title: Making client one file
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Make your custom client send extra information to the server to filter it from other clients, then obfuscate and jar it.

item.title: Making client one file
item.dc:creator: @Markian Markian
item.description:
@Markian wrote:

[quote=“raped by who, post:2, topic:292632”]delete the .java files

hide the .class files

Unless someone really wants to get onto your server using a cheat client, they’re not gonna waste there time decompiling.

you could always use xStream to extract the .class’s to a diferent file store location too. (if you really need too)[/quote] Seems likes they really want to because that’s what they did. How can I use xStream?

Read full topic

item.title: Making client one file
item.dc:creator: @raped_by_who raped by who
item.description:
@raped_by_who wrote:

delete the .java files

hide the .class files

Unless someone really wants to get onto your server using a cheat client, they’re not gonna waste there time decompiling.

you could always use xStream to extract the .class’s to a diferent file store location too. (if you really need too)
